page.title: 13CEMETERIES
page.content: Several of Edinburgh's older graveyards have fallen into disrepair. Few new graves are dug nowadays, so they have little current income to pay for maintenance. At North Merchiston and at Dalry cemeteries a number of headstones have been sprayed with paint and others have been smashed or pushed over. The grass and weeds are up to 7 feet high in summer and rubbish such as old sinks lie dumped beside the graves. The roads through the graveyards have deteriorated to muddy tracks. Few people attend to the family graves, but only a few pounds a year from everybody who owned a lair would be enough to employ a gardener. A property developer has now offered to buy the cemeteries, re-locate the lairs and build houses on this land, a prime site, close to the city centre. No doubt there will be many objections
